comment: Class was online due to COVID. Little did I know that Judy is not willing to learn how to use D2L. All of the work including tests have to be submitted through email. If you email her with any concerns you will not hear form her. She's not good at explaining how to hear chord qualities. She once said "well I don't know how to help with that"

Judy is an amazing performer, but I do not like being her student in AS IV. With virtual classes, all of the assignments are due online. Instead of using D2L, she does all of the grading by hand and we have to email her all hw/tests. She doesn't send out grades and she wont respond to emails or take time during class to help students individually.

TAKE HER! She actually made this class interesting. Go to class, pay attention, do all the required work and you will get an A without a doubt. Attendance was mandatory, but you are allowed to miss 6 classes without being penalized.
Unfortunately, attendance is required in this class. It's such a joke there's no need to go. Easiest A in college.

Professor Cole cares about her students and music.  Occasionally she'll play the keyboard to show what she means.  She is a good pianist. Attendance is mandatory and a sheet is passed around.  The tests are pretty easy. If you show up for the study class before the test and record it you should be good. 3 events outside of class are required too.

This teacher is very clear on what she expects. Theres four tests, three performances you need to attend and then one paper ( only one page) about one of the performances. Class is mandatory but not completely excruciating. Overall an easy professor.

Not terrible for a gen ed requirement. Professor Cole is nice and approachable. Go to the review sessions for tests, they're a lot easier if you do. She'll give you most of the questions/answers. Class is neither super exciting nor unbelievably boring. You fail if you have 6+ abscense, as per the department requirements. Did use textbook.

Boring but easy class.  Attendance required.  I barely opened the book or took notes and I got an A.  The only thing that really sucked is having to attend 3 events, including an ASO symphony.  It got a little pricey.

Actually learned alot in this class. Not modern music so don't get too excited. Very good at explaining concepts. Tests are very easy, she goes over the test before she gives it the next class. Attendance is manfatory. She is a nice lady. Uses lots of youtube videos and her piano to demonstrate musical concepts which is interesting.
It's incredibly boring, but you can use your laptop. I didn't take any notes for one section and made a 100 on the test. Easy A.

I loved this class! Dr. Cole is interesting and very passionate about music. Easy A for sure. Make sure to take notes day before the test, she would usually give the answers to several test questions. Even if you don't know anything about music, you can still make an A in this class. There are 3 required concerts.

She loves music, but all she does is lecture and play classical music. The class is really easy though. All you have to do is show up for class and listen to her go over the test the day before the exam... Easy A, for sure... If you can stay awake...

She is really disorganized, only lectures. The study guides are confusing. She makes you listen to several 8min long pieces in every class. She doesn't say too much in lecture, and she pauses for 7 seconds b/t every thought, which makes the lecture slow and drawn out. Easy A, but boring! Lots of outside reading and work. But she is really nice!
Very sweet! She wants you to learn. Music is her passion and she tries to share it with you. You have a few field trips you have to do on your own but they're not hard. Easy A.

This professor is great and really loves music, and teaching music. She plays songs every class and when you get to music in film you watch clips of different movies. She takes role, there are three tests and you ahve to go to three performances and write a two page paper. It's not easy but didn't work extremely hard and I got an A.

This class almost made me hate music, and I play in a band. This class is easy, but horribly boring. I didn't touch the textbook and I made an A. Take her if you don't want to get boned by a required arts course. The only downfall is the price of required concerts.

I really enjoyed Prof Cole. This class was not as easy as I had expected which turned out to be great because I learned a lot from her. She gives some extra credit and her test are fairly easy if you attend class and use the study guide.

Easy A! especially if you have a musical background. Professor Cole is also very friendly & a talented musician. Makes you go to concerts but there are free ones offered on campus. If you show up to class and sort of pay attention, you will do great.
GREAT PROF! she is really nice and wants for you to understand. Her class is an easy A! Study your notes, attend all required events, and you will do fine. Great class. Take HER!

She's an awesome professor and so nice! She is willing to help you in any way she can so you will get an A. She lectures and throws in random funny stories that keep them interesting. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! Nicest professor ever!

Mrs. Cole is an awesome teacher. She is super easy.  If you go to class and half way pay attention you will make a good grade.  Attendance is required.  The class isnt very interesting but this is a great teacher to take if you are looking for an A.  Make sure to show up on review days! Very helpful!

Professor is easy and goes over all test questions on review days. Study guide is provided as well. Easy course. Attendance required. Can pass with high grade if you Youtube the music selections and pay attention in class.

I took this class thinking it would be an easy class. I was wrong. She covers a lot of material and the test are very detailed. She gives study guides that help but dont cover everything. You also have to attend events outside of class, one of which is in Atlanta. Not a lot of homework is given other than studying for test.
SUPER easy....let's just say I'm in her class right now. And I know I'll make an A. Need a free A? Take this class.

Lectures are super boring! You just listen to music the whole time and occassionally she'll show off her piano skills. Her tests aren't hard at all if you show up on review days. She goes over majority of the questions that'll be on the test. Test is MC with the listening section. ATTENDANCE IS MANDATORY: only 5 absences allowed.

she's super lenient and fairly easy to work with. Can't miss more than 4 days.  Classes are super boring. Test are SUPER HARD. STUDY! 3 tests the last 2 count as the midterm and final. 4 required events have to be all different, and one has to be an attendance at the Atlanta Symphony Orchestra.

It's a hard job to cover 1000's of years worth of music in 3 months but she did it. Read the chapters and go to class.If that's hard for you, don't go to college.  Usher 3 music concerts at KSU and get 5 points on your TOTAL grade.
easy to get an A if you come to class and do all the assignments (4 concert attendances). Lecture is VERY boring.
